table_schema: CREATE TABLE cards (uuid TEXT PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, flavorText TEXT, text TEXT, type TEXT)
question: What is the archetype of Twilight Prophet?

hypothetical_relevant_data.name: Twilight Prophet
hypothetical_relevant_data.flavorText: The blood of the ancients flows in her veins, and the whispers of the dead echo in her mind.
hypothetical_relevant_data.text:
Flying
Ascend (If you control ten or more permanents, you get the city’s blessing for the rest of the game.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have the city’s blessing, reveal the top card of your library and put it into your hand. Each opponent loses X life and you gain X life, where X is that card’s mana value.

udf_justification: Card archetype classification (aggro, control, combo) requires an understanding of strategic mechanics, which is beyond standard SQL. An LLM UDF is needed to interpret card text and classify it appropriately.

table_schema: CREATE TABLE cards (uuid TEXT PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, flavorText TEXT, text TEXT, type TEXT); CREATE TABLE rulings (uuid TEXT, date TEXT, ruling TEXT)
question: Summarize the rulings for the card 'Esper Sojourners'.

hypothetical_relevant_data.name: Esper Sojourners
hypothetical_relevant_data.text: When you cycle Esper Sojourners or it dies, you may tap target permanent.

hypothetical_relevant_data.ruling: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that prevent activated abilities won't prevent cycling.
The triggered ability acts as a cycle-triggered ability.

expected_result.name: Esper Sojourners
expected_result.summary: Cycling is an activated ability not affected by suppression, and it triggers another ability when used.

udf_justification: Summarizing multiple rulings into a coherent statement requires semantic aggregation beyond SQL capabilities.

table_schema: CREATE TABLE cards (uuid TEXT PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, flavorText TEXT, text TEXT, type TEXT); CREATE TABLE rulings (uuid TEXT, ruling TEXT)
question: Which cards with positive flavor text sentiment also have complex rulings? Summarize the rulings.

hypothetical_relevant_data.name: Crested SunmareCrested Sunmare
hypothetical_relevant_data.flavorText: It is evidence that some pure corner of the world must still exist
hypothetical_relevant_data.text:
Other Horses you control have indestructible.
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained life this turn, create a 5/5 white Horse creature token

hypothetical_relevant_data.ruling: If a creature has been dealt damage, that damage remains marked on it until the cleanup step. If another Horse you control has been dealt lethal damage, and later in the turn Crested Sunmare leaves the battlefield, that Horse will be destroyed.

Crested Sunmare’s triggered ability won’t trigger unless you’ve gained life in the turn before the end step began. It can’t be satisfied by another triggered ability causing you to gain life during that end step.

Crested Sunmare’s triggered ability cares only whether you gained life in the turn, even if Crested Sunmare wasn’t on the battlefield when that happened. It doesn’t care how much you gained, whether you also lost life, or even whether you lost more life t

hypothetical_relevant_data.name: Helm of the Gods
hypothetical_relevant_data.flavorText: Its blessings are as numerous as the stars of Nyx.
hypothetical_relevant_data.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

hypothetical_relevant_data.ruling: If you cast an Aura spell targeting a permanent controlled by an opponent, you still control that Aura. It will count toward the bonus given by Helm of the Gods

expected_result.name: Crested SunmareCrested Sunmare
expected_result.summary: Damage stays until cleanup. If Sunmare leaves after lethal Horse damage, it dies. Needs life gain before end step, not during.

expected_result.name: Helm of the Gods
expected_result.summary: You control Auras cast on opponent's permanents. They count for Helm of the Gods' bonus.

udf_justification: Sentiment analysis is needed for evaluating emotional tone; summarization is needed to condense multiple rulings into one coherent explanation.

table_schema: CREATE TABLE cards (uuid TEXT PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, flavorText TEXT, text TEXT, type TEXT); CREATE TABLE rulings (uuid TEXT, date TEXT, ruling TEXT)
question: Which cards have rulings that mention 'damage prevention'?

hypothetical_relevant_data.name: Divine Deflection
hypothetical_relevant_data.flavorText: Only the divine may dictate the course of fate.
hypothetical_relevant_data.text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to any number of target creatures and/or players this turn...

hypothetical_relevant_data.ruling: Damage prevention effects apply even if a creature would deal more damage than is prevented.

hypothetical_relevant_data.name: Blizzard Brawl
hypothetical_relevant_data.text: Choose target creature you control and target creature you don't control. If you control three or more snow permanents, the creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains indestructible until end of turn...

hypothetical_relevant_data.ruling: Check whether you control three or more snow permanents as Blizzard Brawl is resolving to see if the target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains indestructible. That creature will still fight even if it doesn’t get those bonuses..
If either target is an illegal target as Blizzard Brawl tries to resolve, neither creature will fight and no damage will be dealt.

udf_justification: Requires language understanding and detection in text fields after joining rulings and cards on UUID.
